# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

We provide security updates for the following versions:

| Version | Supported |
|---------|-----------|
| Latest 2.x | ✅ Yes |
| Latest 1.x | ⚠️ Limited |
| < 1.0 | ❌ No |

## Reporting a Vulnerability

We take security vulnerabilities seriously. Please report vulnerabilities responsibly.

### How to Report

1. **Do NOT** open a public GitHub issue
2. Email: security@cyber-mercenary.example.com
3. Include:
   - Description of the vulnerability
   - Steps to reproduce
   - Potential impact
   - Your name and organization (optional)

### Response Timeline

| Severity | Initial Response | Resolution Target |
|----------|-----------------|-------------------|
| Critical | 1 hour | 24 hours |
| High | 4 hours | 72 hours |
| Medium | 24 hours | 2 weeks |
| Low | 48 hours | 4 weeks |

### What to Expect

1. We acknowledge receipt within 24 hours
2. We assess severity and impact
3. We develop a fix and coordinate disclosure
4. We credit you (if desired) in release notes

## Scope

This policy applies to:

- Cyber-Mercenary API (`agent/src/api/`)
- Smart contracts (`contracts/`)
- Core agent logic (`agent/src/services/`)
- Documentation and scripts

### Out of Scope

- Third-party services (RPC providers, AI APIs)
- User environment configuration
- Social engineering attacks
- Physical security

## Disclosure Policy

- We follow responsible disclosure
- We coordinate with researchers on timelines
- We provide updates throughout the process
- We credit responsible researchers

## Safe Harbor

We commit to:

- Not pursue legal action against researchers
- Work cooperatively to resolve issues
- Recognize your contribution (with permission)
- Keep communications confidential until resolution

## Contact

- Security: security@cyber-mercenary.example.com
- General: support@cyber-mercenary.example.com
- PGP Key: Available on request

## Acknowledgments

Thank you to the security researchers who help make Cyber-Mercenary secure.
